# NSGlyphStorage

**Protocol**

A set of methods that a glyph storage object must implement to interact properly with [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSGlyphGenerator].

## Declaration

```swift
protocol NSGlyphStorage
```

## Overview

An example of a class that conforms to the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSGlyphStorage] protocol is [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSLayoutManager].

## Returning text storage

- **attributedString()**: Returns the text storage object from which the `NSGlyphGenerator` object procures characters for glyph generation.

## Returning glyph display options

- **layoutOptions()**: Returns the current layout options.

## Modifying the glyph cache

- **insertGlyphs(_:length:forStartingGlyphAt:characterIndex:)**: Inserts the given glyphs into the glyph cache and maps them to the specified characters.
- **setIntAttribute(_:value:forGlyphAt:)**: Sets a custom attribute value for a given glyph.

## Constants

- **Layout Options**: Layout options returned as a bit mask by the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSGlyphStorage/layoutOptions()] method.

## Glyphs

- **NSGlyph**: The type used to specify glyphs.
- **NSGlyphGenerator**: An object that performs the initial, nominal glyph generation phase in the layout process.
- **NSGlyphInfo**: A glyph attribute in an attributed string.
- **Reserved Glyph Codes**: These constants define reserved glyph codes.
- **NSFontRenderingMode**: The font rendering mode.

## Conforming Types

- NSLayoutManager
